name: A Bit Of Fun - Fighter 14 / CoT 18 / Rogue 8 (Dual-Wield)
author: Stagmeister

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello All,

Over the course of the Easter weekend my brain seized up with too many options for another build I'm trying to finalize, so I thought, as a bit of fun, "I'll just take a blast through the OC and Aribeth's Redemption just hitting stuff with something I'll make up on the hoof." But it seems my spontaneity button's been broken by the ECB, so I ended up drawing up a full schemata. While it worked well for me (hence my sharing it), I will stress that it is for the OC, so I have no idea how it would work elsewhere - perhaps you could let me know if it could stand up in other environments. Equally, I've only taken it as far as Level 25, and I haven't checked other builds for similarities. So, three reasons for locating it here rather than in the Full Epic section.

Okay, that's the disclaimers out of the way. For the dual-wielding I went for Scimitar and Light Hammer, though Morningstar or Warhammer and Handaxe would look cool, and the smart option would probably be Scimitar and Swordsword, but do feel free to pick your own (and if you double-up with small weapons, you'll open plenty more feats up). If you have comments, please dive in!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Looks good.
Damage will be +17 on main hand and +11 off hand. Add +5 if you use PA.

This one reminds me of a dual wielder I played once: His name was Igor. He was dressed in all red and wielded a golden hammer and sickle. ;p

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Like it, Mick - Champions of Trotsky unite! (Replace sickle with ice-pick and you've really got something

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: I know what I did about the damage, hurrah! I counted WS and EWS as +1 and +2, rather than +2 and +4, and I'm guessing they don't apply to the off hand - which, if I'm right, means I might as well bin those two feats and take something else. Damn it, now you've made me care!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I have never heard of the idea that WS might not apply to the off-hand. Look it up in the wiki and if it is not mentioned in the WS article, it is not true.
http://nwn.wikia.com/wiki/Main_Page

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks Empyre. I looked it up and you're right, it isn't WS related. Apparently when dual-wielding the main weapon gets full STR as a damage bonus, while the off-hand gets half that (rounded down). I didn't know that - probably why we find more DEXers dual-wielding.

I've edited the build to reflect the change
